thread.title: Saracens' Barritt gets three-week ban for dangerous tackle
thread.title_full: Saracens' Barritt gets three-week ban for dangerous tackle

title: Saracens' Barritt gets three-week ban for dangerous tackle
text:
Saracens' Brad Barritt suspended for dangerous tackle but Richard Barrington cleared 10 Jan From the section Rugby Union Share this page Saracens captain Brad Barritt has been banned for three weeks after admitting to a dangerous tackle on Exeter lock Geoff Parling. 
Prop Richard Barrington, sent off for his part in Saturday's incident, was cleared by a Rugby Football Union disciplinary panel in London. 
Barrington, 27, is now free to play again immediately, while Barritt, 30, is suspended until 31 January. 
An RFU statement said Barritt's ban was in line with new high-tackle laws. 
More to follow.
